children.subject: Honestly, just take the one that fits with your schedule. Don't postpone the class just to take it with a different teacher; 61B is one of (if not the) the most crucial CS classes you will take here so it is good to take it ASAP. I took it with Hilfinger, and it was tough but I ended up with a decent grade and learned a lot (as frustrating as things got sometimes...). I've heard that Hug is a good teacher but the tests are harder/worth more. Each has its pros/cons, but IMO none of them are significant enough to delay the class.

history.content: I took CS 61B with Professor Hug. He teaches very well. I think the projects, labs, and homework are easy and I got full marks on them plus almost all golden points of projects. I am better at coding than taking exams. I got average in three exams and finally got a B+, also the average. Professor Hilfinger's projects are harder and more time consuming, but the exams are easier. From the course websites, I see that projects are worth more in Hilfinger's class than in Hug's class. I agree with the anon below. CS 61B is very important and you should better take it asap.

children.subject:
More discussion in @9437, but please take the one that fits your schedule. You would only try to optimize by professor if one is the worst, but that doesn't apply in this situation - you will learn a ton with either prof.

if you plan to take CS upper divs that require 61b, then taking 61b sooner rather than later is better so you can get a head start on the other classes.

I took Hug and did well, but I had friends who took 61B with Hilfinger and failed tests but got an A. Check out his rubric, and count up the points you need on exams if you get 100% on projects. If you want to declare CS and would rather take the "better grade", go for Hilfinger.

You'll do great either way

history.content: As a freshman, I’m not which to take but I know I can’t go wrong with either. However, I wanted know whose 61B better prepares for a future SWE internship/job. I can see the case for both where harder exams prepares you better for interviews and where harder projects trains your critical thinking skills and prepares for the job. These assumptions may be wrong as I haven’t taken the class yet, but I wanted to hear the perspectives from those who did though I highly doubt someone has experienced both variants of 61B.
history.subject: 61B: Hug vs Hilfinger
